title: Herrick Payoff Index
content:
Herrick Payoff Index (HPI) is an index, which shows inflow or outflow of funds from the futures market. The formula was developed by John Herrick and was based on the analysis of price, open interest and trading volume changes.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Drawing

NameDescription
Panel Determines the display location of the indicator: it can either integrate within the main chart area or appear on a separate panel below the chart.
Buy Color Displays the color of an element with a positive value.
Sell Color Displays the color of an element with a negative value.

Settings

NameDescription
Divisor The divisor is used to bring the result into a convenient format by dividing it by a certain coefficient.
Smooth Defines a multiplication factor that converts values into a convenient format.

Misc

NameDescription
Show description The parameter controls the visibility of the indicator's name and its parameters on the chart, enabling the display of this information to be toggled on or off.
